evidence.text:
Person B: What? What are you staring at? Oh-- do I have something in my teeth?
Person A: But... you're... green.

Person B: Yes, and it's my intention to major in sorcery, so-- if at some future time you wanted to-- address the problem? Perhaps I could-- help.
Person A: Offering to help someone you don't know with a skill you don't have. I'm sure everyone's duly impressed.

Person A: Couldn't.
Person A: You "couldn't" care less what other people think. Though I doubt that's true.

Person A: For instance, and this is just an example, I could lend you some clothes, til your luggage arrives. Since you've-- nothing to wear.
Person A: And in return, perhaps you could-- let's see-- put in a good word for me? With Madame Morrible? Deal?

Person A: Dearest darlingest Momsie and Popsical...
Person A: "Guess what?"
Person B: "In regards t o your request that I move in with Nessa--"
Person A: "I can't hear your guesses because this is a letter."
Person B: "I know she wouldn't want me to--" "I know how much she wants to be--"
Person A: "So I'll just tell you."
Person A: Maybe the pronuncifi-cation of your precious name is not the sole focus of Doctor Dillamond's life. Maybe he's not like every other Professor, maybe some of us are different!
Person B: And there he is, with Galinda of course. They deserve each other.
Person B: And we were just talking about you! How you should join us tonight!

Person B: You. Join. Us. A t the Ozdust. I'm inviting you!
Person A: Why.
Person B: Because everyone will be there. And don't tell me you've nothing to wear, you could wear-- let's see--
Person B: She looks around, then-- holds the black hat out to Elphaba.
Person B: --this!
Person B: I mean, it goes with everything you own!

Person B: I know! Let's each tell the other something we've never told an yone! I'll go first: Fiyero and I are getting married!
Person B: Oh, he doesn't know yet. Now you tell me a secret.
Person A: It was my mother's, that's all.
Person A: My father hates me.
Person A: That's not the secret. The secret is. .. He has a good reason. It's my fault.
Person B: What, what is?
Person B: Green?
Person A: He was so worried, he made our mother chew milk flowers, day and night. Only it made Nessa c ome too soon... with her little legs all tangled. And our mother... never woke up.
Person A: None of which would ever have happened... if not for me.
Person B: But that was the milkflowers' fault, not yours.
Person B: That may be your secret, Elphaba. But it doesn't make it true.
Person B: Now, you're sure you have everything? Elphie!

Person B: Nessa...
Person B: There are other boys. Who you may not have noticed. Who've noticed you.

Person A: Elphie!
Person B: Where's Nessa?
Person A: She left with your father. She said to wish you safe travels. She'll be fine, Elphie. She'll have to manage without you. We all will.
